data.title: First visit review
data.text:
Love a good fish sandwich.  I really was surprised they serve it with ketchup, mustard, tomatoes and onions.  That was ok but I like the traditional fish sandwich with tartar sauce.

The fish was very delicious!  Fries were average.  It's all about the fish!

No seating except for a picnic table.  Plan to take your food to go.

data.title: If the locals love it, maybe it's worth a try!
data.text:
When I moved to Lakeland, the first two questions I asked were: 'Where is the top fresh seafood market?' and "Who has the best fried fish sandwich?"
Everyone gave the same answers. Lakeland Seafood on Memorial and Mr. Fish on Lake Morton.
I've been going to Mr. Fish for 9 years now and the fish sandwich is always hot and crispy without being greasy. They are fried to order. I like to have the huge, handmade onion rings and cole slaw, too, when I am really hungry. The sides do not detract from the meal, but provide excellent accompaniment. It can be a challenge to find top-flight onion rings anywhere these days.
I usually walk mine right down to the corner where there is a bench with a great view of the lake (but away from hungry waterfowl!)

data.title: Lakeland landmark restaurant.
data.text: Great fish sandwich. Have never been inside so can't comment on that, but have placed take out several times and always pleased with results.

data.title: icon deserves respect
data.text: food good. just a little place but worth the wait. good service. nice location and ambiance. good side dishes

data.title: A a well-loved local spot for yummy fish sandwiches
data.text: If you don't need fancy, want a light meal, and like fish, check out Mister Fish. Very satisfying: one picnic table, but most people get their meals to go.

data.title: Yummy fish sandwich.
data.text: Great local place for a fried fish sandwich.  This place has been around forever for a reason.  They know what they are doing.  Great fish, fried okra, corn fritters and fries.  Grab and go food.

data.title: Excellent Fish sanwiches
data.text: This place has been here for years..order at walk up window, couple benches to eat at with a beautiful view of the lake and the library is across the street...Very reputable place to eat with decent prices...very well known in town and everyone loves the food, it's well worth it, highly recommend eating here.

data.title: Mister Fish Sandwich
data.text: At first glance Mister Fish doesn't look like much, it only has six parking spots and one outdoor table, but the eatery has a local following largely because of the Mister Fish Sandwich. This sandwich is delicious! The fish is flakey and coated in a lightly crispy breading.

data.title: Best Fish Sandwiches and more!
data.text: Our family has picked up lunch and occasional dinner for years from this take out only Lakeland landmark.  They are known for fish dinners and sandwiches- sides are also quite good, including hushpuppies.   Can be busy during lunch.   They offer many other sandwiches, and dinners including shrimp, chicken tenders, hamburgers, mac and cheese and fried mac and cheese!   Good iced tea.   Family owned team is always on site and always friendly.

data.title: A Lakeland Landmark...
data.text: Mr. Fish is an unassuming place to chow down on some good eats.  While known for the deep fried fish sandwich that hangs out of the bun, I usually opt for the chicken sandwich.  It hangs out of the bun too and is always perfect with sweet iced tea and a side of their to-die-for corn nuggets.  Everything else on the menu is equally as excellent.  There's always a smile coming your way when they shove aside the little window you order through too.  Don't forget to leave a tip.  They've earned it.

data.title: Lite lunch
data.text: Love this little shack at lunch time. It's just enough to hold you until dinner time. The fish sandwich has just the perfect ingredients with a crispy texture. The sides are delish too.

data.title: Fishing for a light lunch
data.text: This is a little hole in the wall place. It's al take-out & has one picnic table. Within a stones throw of a nice lake to have lunch on & watch the swans. The fish was good plus they have other items. Been there since 1964 I believe.

data.title: Shopping
data.text: I go to often. The food is great . I love cornmeal breaded fish ,OMG ,and the fried chicken to die for.the one Kathrine Dr is the spot to go,good and hot.Fair prices too.

data.title: Best fish sandwich, unique locale
data.text: Find it and enjoy - it's a tiny shack with great fish sandwiches. Whenever I get near Lakeland I beeline it straight to Mister Fish for great food - take-out only but walk down the block to dine lakeside and watch the beautiful swans from your park bench.

data.title: One of my work day favorites for Lunch.
data.text: Call in your order and swing in and pick up a basket.     Very well priced for some really good comfort food.     Parking is a bit rough, but they will get you in and out quick if you call ahead.   Lunch time they are slammed so you will wait a bit if you just walk up.

data.title: Best Fish
data.text: Small place, but the best fish sandwich I've ever tasted. Prices are high. Which they had a larger location with seating commodities.

data.title: BEST FISH......EVER
data.text: Hidden away with little parking and no seating and hardly a place to stand undercover if it's raining. But well worth it. Close to Lake Morton and the Library this Lakeland hidden gem is a favorite with all. LARGE pieces of fish that are cooked to perfection on a plate or sandwich. Try it once and return over and over. Dont miss this.

data.title: Best Fried Fish in Town
data.text: This dive has been around as long as I can remember. The reason is simple small batches of fish served up just the way your grandparents used to make. It's not a fancy place, in fact there is no inside. Place your order at the walk up window and wait while it is prepared fresh to order. Take your order to enjoy elsewhere. Since it is directly across fron the library & just off of Lake Morton, there are some nice options close by. Bring your patience and they will be rewarded; no matter what time of day, there is always a line.They are just that good!

data.title: Delicious!
data.text: Ok, so for everyone looking for delicious, inexpensive food, this is the place for you. If you're looking for a dining experience, forget it, this place is the ultimate definition of a "dive". Food is ordered at a window and if you're lucky, you might get a spot at a bench or pick nick table to eat it. I typically will have my food to go, because the seating arrangements are rather ratchet, but the food is def worth your while. The quality of the fried fish is amazing and the staff seems to follow sanitation procedures. Don't let the outside appearance scare you, the food is great!

data.title: Unusual fish sandwich
data.text: This sandwich is delicious. The menu is full of fried things, onion rings, french fries, hush puppies. Writing about it all I can think of is eating that sandwich.
